Package dispatcher

Class Dispatcher

java.lang.Object
dispatcher.Dispatcher
public class Dispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for creating and running the players. It contains methods to update, create and solve. It also acts an an intermediate (player to player and player to server). There is a screen Panel which is used to hosts the displays of each player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Dispatcher

      public Dispatcher​(ImageFile imageFile, int playersToCreate)
      Create a single player dispatcher for running an algorithm. This is primarily used by the tests
      Parameters:
      imageFile - the image file to be used.
      playersToCreate - the number of players that should be created.

    • Dispatcher

      public Dispatcher​(LocalClient client, int playersToCreate)
      Create a new dispatcher that is used for online multiplayer. Make one player local and the rest passive (updated by the server).
      Parameters:
      client - the object that connects to the server.
      playersToCreate - the number of players to create

    • Dispatcher

      public Dispatcher​(java.io.File customAlgo, ImageFile imageFile)
      Create a single player parser.
      Parameters:
      customAlgo - the file containing the custom algorithm.
      imageFile - the imageFile to be used.

      public long getExecTime()
      Returns:
      a long representing the time taken to execute.

      Returns:

      Returns:

      Parameters:

    • getPlayerScreen

      public java.awt.Component getPlayerScreen​(int index)
      Get the screen currently being displayed by a given player.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the player to get the screen from.
      Returns:
      a JComponent containing the screen.

    • solve

      public void solve​(java.lang.String algorithm, java.lang.String params, boolean multiThreading)
      Call the solve method in the player. Primarily used for testing
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the algorithm to use.
      params - look for neighbours on load or on solve.
      multiThreading - should the algorithm run multithreaded.

    • solve

      public void solve​(java.lang.String algorithm)
      Call the solve method in the player. Primarily used for testing
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the algorithm to use.

    • solve

      public void solve()
      Call the solve method on the player. This is used when the player is using a custom algorithm.

    • fillPlayerPath

      public ImageFile fillPlayerPath()
      Get the player to create an imageFile and fill it in. This is used when two algorithms are running at once.
      Returns:
      the resultant imageFile

    • isLive

      public boolean isLive()
      Check if this is running in live mode.
      Returns:
      a boolean to indicate if live or not.

    • setLive

      public void setLive​(boolean live)
      Parameters:
      live - boolean to indicate if the players should update their displays in real time.

    • makeLoadScreen

      Tell the gui to reset the screen.d
      Parameters:
      tab - the tab to set it to.

      Create a component that renders two players in one screen.

      Make the screen that is used for live solving
      Parameters:
      playerDimensions - the size of each player screen.

      make the online waiting screen
      Parameters:
      resetPlayerTwo - should player two be reset

      Set the screen variable.
      Parameters:

    • makeOnlineStartScreen

      public void makeOnlineStartScreen()
      Make the screen that is used to join/create an online game.

      This contains button for creating and joining a game along with their associated functionality.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(java.lang.Object message)
      Send a message to the server.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to send

    • setOpponentsReady

      public void setOpponentsReady()
      Set the opponents in both players to true

    • startOnline

      public void startOnline()
      Start the online players.

      Note: only player 0 is started because the other player is being updated by the server.

    • updateOnlinePlayer

      public void updateOnlinePlayer​(LocationList locationList)
      Update the online player.
      Parameters:
      locationList - the list of locations to draw

    • setImageProcessor

      public void setImageProcessor​(ImageProcessor imageProcessor)
      Set the image processor in the local player.
      Parameters:
      imageProcessor - the image processor to use

    • getUserName

      public java.lang.String getUserName​(java.lang.String dimension)
      Get the username from the client.
      Parameters:
      dimension - is this player online or local
      Returns:
      the username

    • checkStatus

      public void checkStatus​(Player player)
      Check the status of each of the players to see if they are done. We only need to check if there is more than one player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that has reported done

    • otherDone

      public void otherDone()
      Used by the server to indicate that the other player has finished. In this case it will update player 2 (players.get(1))

    • requestRestart

      public void requestRestart​(Player player)
      Process a requested restart from a player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that requested the restart.

    • showRestartRequest

      public void showRestartRequest()
      Show a message saying that a restart has been requested. Process the response.

    • setupSinglePlayer

      public void setupSinglePlayer()
      Add a single player to the screen
